intro: Pisonia venosa, commonly known as the silky pisonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by birds. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. Pisonia venosa thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas and rainforests.
